text.p: The Philippines and Bangladesh pledged on Tuesday to boost trade by strengthening their countertrade agreement.
Philippine trade secretary Cesar Bautista said in a statement Manila was willing to supply Bangladesh with military hardware, public transport vehicles and pharmaceutical products.
In turn, Bangladesh would import agriculture and agriculture-based products.
The agreement was reached during a two-day meeting in Manila.
Bautista said Dhaka would also ease restrictions on its services sector, allowing Filipinos to invest in road construction and computer education programmes.
In 1996, Bangladesh ranked as the 64th trading partner of he Philippines accounting for only 0.02 percent of its total external trade.
